abstract: Citigroup on Friday said it planned to reshape its board, nominating Ernesto Zedillo, a former president of Mexico, as a director as three others declined to seek re-election.
snippet: Citigroup on Friday said it planned to reshape its board, nominating Ernesto Zedillo, a former president of Mexico, as a director as three others declined to seek re-election.
lead_paragraph: Citigroup on Friday said it planned to reshape its board, nominating the former Mexican president Ernesto Zedillo as a director as three others declined to seek re-election.

headline.main: Citi to Reshape Its Board as 3 Directors Stand Down

abstract: Updated: Bank of America’s ex-chief executive, Kenneth D. Lewis, received about $4.2 million for 2009, comprised largely of an appreciation in the value of his pension benefits, news reports said on Friday, citing a regulatory filing.
snippet: Updated: Bank of America’s ex-chief executive, Kenneth D. Lewis, received about $4.2 million for 2009, comprised largely of an appreciation in the value of his pension benefits, news reports said on Friday, citing a regulatory filing.
lead_paragraph: 4:34 p.m. | Update Bank of America‘s former chief executive, Kenneth D. Lewis, received about $4.2 million for 2009, comprised largely of an appreciation in the value of his pension benefits, news reports said on Friday, citing a regulatory filing.
